greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) + a(n+1) is never prime; lexicographically earliest such sequence of distinct positive integers.
comment: See A253074 for an essentially identical sequence (with a proof that the sequence is a permutation).

Sequence A253074 is defined in the same way, but starting with 0. This happens to produce the same sequence from the next term on. This is the case (M,N) = (2,0) in the family of sequences where M consecutive terms yield N primes in their pairwise sums, see the wiki page for other examples. - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 26 2019
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
M. F. Hasler, Prime sums from neighboring terms, OEIS wiki, Nov. 23, 2019
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
example: a(3) = 5 because 1 and 3 have already been used and both 3 + 2 = 5 and 3 + 4 = 7 are prime while 3 + 5 = 8 is not prime.
maple: N:= 1000; # to get a[n] for n up to N
for n from 2 to N do
mathematica: f[ s_ ]:=Block[ {k=1,a=s[ [ -1 ] ]},While[ Or[ MemberQ[ s,k ],PrimeQ[ a+k ] ],k++ ];Append[ s,k ] ];Nest[ f,{1},121 ] (* _Zak Seidov_, Oct 21 2009 *)

a={1};z=Range[2,2002];z=Complement[z,a];While[Length[z]>1,If[!PrimeQ[z[[1]]+Last[a]],AppendTo[a,z[[1]]],If[!PrimeQ[z[[2]]+Last[a]],AppendTo[a,z[[2]]],AppendTo[a,z[[3]]]]];z=Complement[z,a]];Print[a] (* significantly faster *) (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, May 03 2011 *)
program: f u vs = g vs where
g (w:ws) | a010051' (u + w) == 0 = w : f w (delete w vs)
(PARI) v=[1]; n=1; while(n<100, if(!isprime(n+v[#v])&&!vecsearch(vecsort(v), n), v=concat(v, n); n=0); n++); v \\ _Derek Orr_, Jun 08 2015

(PARI) A055266_upto(n=99, u=1, U, a)={vector(n, n, n=u; while(bittest(U, n-u)|| isprime(a+n), n++); if(n>u, U+=1<<(n-u), U>>=-u+u+=valuation(U+2, 2)); a=n) + if(default(debug), print([u]))} \\ Optional args allow to tweak computation. If debug > 0, print least unused number at the end. - _M. F. Hasler_, Nov 25 2019
